Instruction: Trim excess fat from the pork shoulder and cut it into bite-sized cubes.
Chop the onion, mince the garlic, and grate the ginger.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the pork cubes to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, and cayenne pepper, and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Peel and dice the potatoes and carrots, then add them to the skillet.
Season the curry with salt and black pepper, then cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the pork and vegetables are tender.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve the pork curry hot, over steamed rice or with naan bread, and enjoy!
